New Records: RJ Barrett recorded his first triple-double with 25 points, 15 assists, and 10 rebounds
Key Match Events: The game went into overtime with the score tied at 123-123 before Tatum's game-winning shot.
With the game tied, Toronto won a coach's challenge on an out-of-bounds call, but Barrett's layup attempt was blocked by Neemias Queta, setting up the final possession for Boston.
Pre-Game Insights: The Raptors were on a seven-game losing streak and had not yet secured their first road win of the season.
Post-Match Reflections: The Celtics improved to 11-3 with the win and avoided losing for the third time at TD Garden this season.
The Raptors' Jakob Poeltl had a career-high 35 points, finishing 16 of 19 from the field with 12 rebounds.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bruno Fernando was helped off the court after an awkward landing but returned to play.
The Raptors outscored the Celtics 76-42 in the paint, a significant area of focus for both teams.
